Description: Lower body sherd of Chian Animal Chalice or Grand Style pottery heavy chalice; white slip; interior glazed black; from top: trace of added white; added red and white bands; band of lotus buds in white outline with red centres; exterior: three bands.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College London. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Chalice kraters are found only in the Animal Chalice and Grand Styles.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1625) (phase 2)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: ucl np 70 (Other Accession Number)
